ecosystem.siem: Security Information and Event Management V2-SIEM

SIEM.title: CENTRALIZED INFORMATION SECURITY MONITORING MANAGEMENT SYSTEM
SIEM.title6: SECURITY ALERTS AND AUTOMATICALLY PREVENT ATTACKS
SIEM.content1: Network devices, security devices: Router, Switch, Firewall/IPS/IDS, Sandbox WAF, Network APT.
SIEM.content2: System servers on different platforms: Windows, Linux, Unix.
SIEM.content3: Applications serving the operation of the system: DHCP, DNS, NTP, VPN, Proxy Server,...; Application service providers: Web, Mail, FPT, TFTP and database management systems Oracle, SQL, IP Camera.
SIEM.content4: Terminal devices: User computer, printer, fax machine, IP Phone, IP Camera.
SIEM.content5: Automatically normalize log data received from devices and applications.
SIEM.content6: Automatically update new log formats from Cloud
SIEM.content7: Detecting network attack based on Web application access log analysis.
SIEM.content8: Detecting malicious domain queries based on DNS log analysis.
SIEM.content9: Detecting connections to malicious IP addresses based on device and operating system connection log analysis.
SIEM.content10: Automatic updates from the Cloud about web application attack detection, list of malicious domains and addresses.
SIEM.content11: Allowance of establishing rules to automatically conduct correlation analysis of various log sources to detect network attacks.
SIEM.content12: Abnormal behavior detection to accurately detect the target and being attacked based on the ability to automatically analyze the alerts received from the system.
SIEM.content13: Administrator permissions to generate a set of rules to detect anomalous user behavior and abnormal network connections on the system.
SIEM.content14: Setting up available rules to detect the following behaviors:
SIEM.content16: Attack behavior from a source address when conducting different type of network attacks to the protected system.
SIEM.content18: Network attack by using malicious code, malware.
SIEM.content20: Update threat intelligence data from the Cloud.
SIEM.content21: Automatically update blacklist (IP, DOMAIN, HASH) for SIEM from threat intelligence data.
SIEM.content22: Allowance of sharing information with threat intelligence systems.
SIEM.content23: Integrated information security vulnerability management function.
SIEM.content24: Automatically warning when detecting information security weaknesses in the system.
SIEM.content25: Allowance of setting virtual patch policy to protect the system.
SIEM.content26: Integrate the function of looking up information related to vulnerabilities and weaknesses
SIEM.content27: Automatic warning of attacks via SMS, Email, ...
SIEM.content28: The system provides interoperability with network devices (Router Cisco - Juniper, Firewall Cisco PIX - ASA, Firewall, Check-Point, Firewall Forgtinet,...), Security devices (Firewall, NAC, IDS, IPS) and operating systems (Windows Server, Linux, Centos, Fedora, Ubuntu, Debian, Linux, Transparent Firewall,...) to conduct network attack prevention.
SIEM.content29: This ability allows the systems to prevent network attacks without affecting the operation and performance of the systems; and does not require the installation of Agents on devices or servers.
SIEM.content31: ALLOWANCE OF DETECTION AND INVESTIGATION OF ATTACKS AND INCIDENTS.
SIEM.content32: ALLOWANCE OF IN-DEPTH LOG ANALYSIS FOR EACH INFORMATION FIELD.
SIEM.content33: ALLOWANCE OF INCIDENT ANALYSIS AND INVESTIGATION THROUGH AN INTUITIVE INTERFACE.
SIEM.content34: The Dashboard function allows administrators to have general information about the system.
SIEM.content35: The Event Map function allows real-time visualization of network attacks.
SIEM.content36: The report generation function allows administrators to create customized reports according to specific conditions in different formats.
SIEM.content39: Managing system software updates from the Cloud.
SIEM.content41: Managing logs operating on the system.
SIEM.content42: System management via Console và SSH

WAF.title: WEB APPLICATION FIREWALL SYSTEM
WAF.title5: SECURITY ALERTS AND AUTOMATICALLY PREVENT ATTACKS
WAF.content1: Web Application Firewall is a solution to protect applications against cyber attacks. WAF is a hardware or software device installed on a server that monitors information by using the http/https protocol between a user's browser and a web server. WAF enforces security policies based on attack signatures, standard protocols, and anomalous web application traffic.
WAF.content5: Implemented with Web Cache Communication Protocal (WCCP).
WAF.content6: Allowance of establishing a set of rules to automatically conduct correlation analysis of various log sources to detect network attacks.
WAF.content7: Abnormal behavior detection to accurately detect the target and being attacked based on the ability to automatically analyze the alerts received from the system.
WAF.content8: Administrator permissions to generate a set of rules to detect anomalous user behavior and abnormal network connections on the system.
WAF.content11: IP ADDRESS CLASSIFICATION BY GEOGRAPHIC COORDINATES.
WAF.content25: Automatic warning of attacks via SMS, Email,...
WAF.content26: The system provides interoperability with network devices (Router Cisco - Juniper, Firewall Cisco PIX - ASA, Firewall Check-Point, Firewall Fortigate,..), Security devices (Firewall, NAC, IDS, IPS) and operating systems (Windows Server, Linux Centos, Fedora, Ubuntu, Debian, Linux Transparent Firewall,...) to conduct network attack prevention.
WAF.content27: This ability allows the systems to prevent network attacks without affecting the operation and performance of the systems; and does not require the installation of Agents on devices or servers.
WAF.content28: Allowance of in-depth log analysis for each information field.
WAF.content29: Allowance of creation correlation rules to detect and investigate attacks and incidents.
WAF.content30: Allowance of incident analysis and investigation through an intuitive interface.
WAF.content31: DASHBOARD FUNCTION ALLOWS ADMINISTRATORS TO HAVE GENERAL INFORMATION ABOUT THE SYSTEM.
WAF.content32: BEHAVIOR BLOCKING FUNCTION ENABLES MANAGEMENT OF BEHAVIORAL ATTACK DETECTION AND PREVENTION ALERTS.
WAF.content33: REPORT GENERATION FUNCTION ALLOWS ADMINISTRATORS TO CREATE CUSTOMIZED REPORTS ACCORDING TO SPECIFIC CONDITIONS IN DIFFERENT FORMATS.
WAF.content35: MANAGING SYSTEM SOFTWARE UPDATES FROM THE CLOUD.
WAF.content37: MANAGING LOGS OPERATING ON THE SYSTEM.
WAF.content38: SYSTEM MANAGEMENT VIA CONSOLE VÀ SSH.

NIPS.title: THE NEW GENERATION NETWORK ATTACK PREVENTION SYSTEM
NIPS.idea1: Detecting network attacks based on a set of attack detection signatures
NIPS.idea2: Detecting network attacks based on anomalous activity on the system
NIPS.idea3: Detecting malicious behavior based on system anomalous network connection
NIPS.content1: The system has ability to analyze the network connection to detect network attacks without affecting the operation of the protected system.
NIPS.content2: Detecting abnormal activities on the system based on the attack detection signature set.
NIPS.content3: Types of network attack that target users inside the system.
NIPS.content6: Anomalous network connection detected on the system.
NIPS.content8: Detecting malicious software activities over the network environment.
NIPS.content11: Attacks on Web server (IIS, Apache, Oracle,...)
NIPS.content12: Attacks on the Database server (Mssql, Mysql, Oracle,...)
NIPS.content13: Attacks on the Email server (POP3, IMAP, SMTP,...)
NIPS.content14: Attacks on Web Application (SQL/XSS/Command Line Injection, HTTP detour attack, Inclusion Vulnerabili-ties, Brute Force,...)
NIPS.content15: The Behavior Detection function allows detections of anomalous behavior to accurately detect attackers and attacked objects based on the ability to automatically analyze warnings received from the system.
NIPS.content16: The Behavior Detection function allows administrators to establish a set of rules in order to detect anomalous user behavior and abnormal network connections on the system.
NIPS.content17: The Behavior Detection function is set up with available rule sets to detect the following behaviors:
NIPS.content19: Attack behavior from a source address when conducting different type of network attacks to the protected system.
NIPS.content21: Network attack by using malicious code, malware.
NIPS.content22: The system provides interoperability with network devices (Router, Switch), security device (Firewall) and operating systems (Windows, Linux,...) to conduct network attack prevention.
NIPS.content23: This ability allows the systems to prevent network attacks without affecting the operation and performance of the systems; and does not require the installation of Agents on devices or servers.
NIPS.content24: THE DASHBOARD FUNCTION ALLOWS ADMINISTRATORS TO HAVE GENERAL INFORMATION ABOUT THE SYSTEM.
NIPS.content25: THE BEHAVIOR BLOCKING FUNCTION ENABLES MANAGEMENT OF BEHAVIORAL ATTACK DETECTION AND PREVENTION ALERTS.
NIPS.content26: THE REPORT GENERATION FUNCTION ALLOWS ADMINISTRATORS TO CREATE CUSTOMIZED REPORTS ACCORDING TO SPECIFIC CONDITIONS IN DIFFERENT FORMATS.
NIPS.content30: MANAGING SYSTEM SOFTWARE UPDATES FROM THE CLOUD.
NIPS.content32: MANAGING LOGS OPERATING ON THE SYSTEM.
NIPS.content34: SYSTEM MANAGEMENT VIA CONSOLE VÀ SSH.

EDR.title: A SOLUTION FOR DETECTION AND RESPONSE TO INFORMATION SECURITY INCIDENTS ON TERMINAL DEVICES
EDR.idea3: MALWARE DETECTION FUNCTION ACCORDING TO IDENTIFICATION SIGNS
EDR.content1: Centralized system information management (Hostname, IP, MAC, Hostfix,...).
EDR.content2: Centralized system information management (Hostname, IP, MAC, Hostfix,...).
EDR.content3: Information security event management on a centralized cross-platform endpoint.
EDR.content4: Managing security policy enforcement on endpoints.
EDR.content5: Detecting network attack, endpoint anomalous behavior based on behavior analysis from system logs.
EDR.content6: Automatically warning, handling and isolating endpoints detected with abnormal behavior.
EDR.content7: Allowance of definition and creation of rules for behavior analysis, enabling correlation analysis to detect APT attacks.
EDR.content8: Detecting malicious attacks on endpoints connected to C&C Server.
EDR.content9: Detecting malicious code attack on malicious domain query endpoint.
EDR.content10: Detecting malicious attacks on endpoints running malware.
EDR.content11: Detecting malicious attacks on endpoints using Yara Rules.
EDR.content12: Detecting malicious attacks on endpoints using the knowledge from the TIP system.
EDR.content13: Tracing, investigating, analyzing events and information security incidents on endpoints.
EDR.content16: Managing processes, system programs that automatically run with the system.
EDR.content17: Managing information of service ports on endpoints.
EDR.content18: Managing system login information on endpoint.
EDR.content19: Managing access information, download data on endpoint.
EDR.content20: Download files to EDR server; Analyze, scan for malware, and upload information on Sandbox.
EDR.content21: Information security incident detection and response solutions on V2-EDR terminals allow management, monitoring, detection of attacks, malware and response mechanisms to protect the server, workstations and terminals. The detection of network attacks, malicious code and processing and response functions are done centrally through Agents installed on servers and workstations.
EDR.content22: Allowance of in-depth log analysis for each information field.
EDR.content23: Allowance of creation correlation rules to detect and investigate attacks and incidents.
EDR.content24: Allowance of incident analysis and investigation through an intuitive interface.
EDR.content25: DASHBOARD FUNCTION ALLOWS ADMINISTRATORS TO HAVE GENERAL INFORMATION ABOUT THE SYSTEM.
EDR.content26: BEHAVIOR BLOCKING FUNCTION ENABLES MANAGEMENT OF BEHAVIORAL ATTACK DETECTION AND PREVENTION ALERTS.
EDR.content27: REPORT GENERATION FUNCTION ALLOWS ADMINISTRATORS TO CREATE CUSTOMIZED REPORTS ACCORDING TO SPECIFIC CONDITIONS IN DIFFERENT FORMATS.
EDR.content30: MANAGING SYSTEM SOFTWARE UPDATES FROM THE CLOUD.
EDR.content32: MANAGING LOGS OPERATING ON THE SYSTEM.
EDR.content33: SYSTEM MANAGEMENT VIA CONSOLE VÀ SSH.

NAC.title: NETWORK ACCESS CONTROL SYSTEM
NAC.content1: The Dashboard function allows administrators to have general information about the system.
NAC.content2: The alerts management function related to behavioral attack detection and prevention.
NAC.content3: The report generation function allows the administrator to create customized reports according to specific conditions.
NAC.content7: Managing system software updates from the Cloud.
NAC.content9: Managing logs operating on the system.
NAC.content10: System management via Console và SSH.
NAC.content11: SYSTEM POLICY OF INTERACTION MECHANISM WITH NETWORK DEVICES (ROUTER, SWITCH), SECURITY DEVICE (FIREWALL) AND OPERATING SYSTEM (WINDOWS, LINUX,...) TO MANAGE ACCESS.
NAC.content12: THE FUNCTION OF AUTOMATICALLY LEARNING NETWORK DEVICE COMPONENTS IN THE SYSTEM..
NAC.content13: THE FUNCTION OF AUTOMATICALLY PROVIDING NETWORK CONNECTION INFORMATION BASED ON SYSTEM POLICY.
NAC.content14: AUTHENTICATION FUNCTION WHEN ACCESSING NETWORK AUTHENTICATION PROXY.
NAC.content15: CONTROLLING ACCESS VIA ACCESS CONTROL LIST (ACLS), VLAN AND TCP RESET.
NAC.content17: MONITORING THE BEHAVIOR AND ENFORCEMENT OF THE DEVICE'S INFORMATION SECURITY POLICY.
NAC.content18: DETECTING AND MANAGING DEVICES IN THE NETWORK.
NAC.content19: DISPLAY OF NETWORK BLOCK NOTIFICATIONS TO USERS.
NAC.content20: DEVICE CLASSIFICATION DUE TO IP RANGE OR SWITCH AND DECENTRALIZATION OF ADMIN RIGHTS BY DEVICE GROUP.
NAC.content21: AUTOMATICALLY WHITELIST THE DEVICES BY MAC ADDRESS, DEVICE TYPE.
NAC.content23: SUPPORT CENTRALIZED SWITCH CONFIGURATION: CONTROLLING PORT, CHANGING VLAN, ...

about.title: ABOUT US
about.district: No. 3, lane 281/75/15 Truong Dinh, Tuong Mai, Hoang Mai District, Hanoi City, Vietnam

form.idea: Tell us about yourself and we’ll figure out the best solution for you and your organization’s needs.
form.content1: One flexible tool for your entire company to share knowledge, ship projects, and collaborate.
form.content2: Enterprise features to securely manage user access and security.
form.content3: Dedicated support to work with you on your setup and help you build the best plan for your company.
